page.title: 19THE TRIM TRAIL_SKELMERSDALE
page.content: The Trim Trail is an exercise course set in an open space or park.It is sited near to the River Tawd in the Tawd Valley.This is the largest open space in our town. The course has 11 obstacles _ including a warm_up area,leapfrog poles and a water crossing.All the obstacles are made of timber to fit in with the landscape.It costs nothing to use and is good fun.Some of the obstacles are difficult but others are easier.At each one there is a plaque which tells you how many exercises to do if you are a beginner or a very fit person. The parkland around is very quiet and pleasant.There is a walkway along the side of the river and a Nature Trail is being established along the wooded valley.
